title: Durham’s First Code Academy: By the Numbers
body:
Back in May, we introduced you to Durham’s first code academy: the instructors, the curriculum and the concept. Today we’re proud (and awed) at the hard work the 22 students have put in over the past 12 weeks. They’ll showcase their work to press and potential employers through their final projects this Friday at Demo Day and we can’t wait to see them!

Students in Durham’s first cohort aren’t just talented though, they’re motivated. Here are some cool facts about Friday’s graduating class:

Cue the Second Batch of Awesome

And because Julia, Clinton, and Jessica don’t have enough going on (yeah...right), they’re going for round two starting next month. The next cohort will begin classes September 15 (and yes, you can still submit an application!) in either Front-end Engineering or Ruby on Rails.

If you’re one of those ambitious (read: badass) souls who wants to try their hands at learning to code, not only do you have time to apply, you have opportunities to save some money while going to school. Read about tuition costs and available scholarships here. 

And Some Fun Pics from our Summer '14 Cohort


(Above) Students attend the Ruby for Good conference in D.C., July 2014. "The conference organizer pulled me aside at one point to tell me how talented our students were. They successfully jumped on both existing and greenfield Rails projects, set up their own dev environment, and knocked out code." - Clinton Dreisbach 

Want to learn more? Visit http://academy.smashingboxes.com/.
